modes.name: Ionian (Major)
modes.pattern: Tone - Tone - Semitone - Tone - Tone - Tone - Semitone

modes.name: Dorian
modes.pattern: Tone - Semitone - Tone - Tone - Tone - Semitone - Tone
modes.sonority: Solemn, ancient, between major and minor.

modes.name: Phrygian
modes.pattern: Semitone - Tone - Tone - Tone - Semitone - Tone - Tone
modes.sonority: Exotic, mysterious, often associated with flamenco.

modes.name: Lydian
modes.pattern: Tone - Tone - Tone - Semitone - Tone - Tone - Semitone
modes.sonority: Bright, dreamy, cheerful (with an augmented fourth).

modes.name: Mixolydian
modes.pattern: Tone - Tone - Semitone - Tone - Tone - Semitone - Tone
modes.sonority: Cheerful, but with a relaxed or folk character (flattened seventh).

modes.name: Aeolian (Natural Minor)
modes.pattern: Tone - Semitone - Tone - Tone - Semitone - Tone - Tone

modes.name: Locrian
modes.pattern: Semitone - Tone - Tone - Semitone - Tone - Tone - Tone
modes.sonority: Dark, unstable, tense (due to the diminished fifth).
